Description: Oval handle sliver of a Rhodian pottery transport amphora. Clay fine pink-buff. Rectangular stamp.
Production date: 152 BC (see N. Badoud, Le temps de Rhodes, 2015, 142.)
Curator's comments: Ink, deleted, '3.0'. Name Pausanias. From same die as Alexandria, Greco-Roman Museum, ABC 0194.11.
Bibliographic references: Stoddart 1847 / Memoir on the inscribed pottery of Rhodes, Cnidus and other Greek Cities (209)
